cookies.name: cookies
cookies.score_description: All cookies use the Secure flag and all session cookies use the HttpOnly flag

public-key-pinning.name: public-key-pinning

redirection.name: redirection
redirection.score_description: Initial redirection is to HTTPS on same host, final destination is HTTPS

strict-transport-security.name: strict-transport-security

subresource-integrity.name: subresource-integrity

testssl.finding: not offered + downgraded to weaker protocol
'renegotiation info/#65281' 'server name/#0' 'EC point formats/#11' 'extended master secret/#23'
Ok via SAN and CN (same w/o SNI)
Some certificate trust checks failed -> Java (chain incomplete)  , OK -> Mozilla Microsoft Linux Apple
certificate has no extended life time according to browser forum
No support for HTTP Public Key Pinning
No Server banner line in header, interesting!
Information leakage: F5 cookie BIGipServerpool-ars.cegedim.cloud-HTTP 834951434.49431.0000 is default IPv4 pool member 10.89.196.49:6081
Multiple X-Content-Type-Options headers. Using first header: nosniff
not vulnerable, no RSA key transport cipher
potentially VULNERABLE, gzip HTTP compression detected  - only supplied '/' tested
not vulnerable on this host and port

Make sure you don't use this certificate elsewhere with SSLv2 enabled services, see https://search.censys.io/search?resource=hosts&virtual_hosts=INCLUDE&q=981ECEBEF4ADC423F8C78833321DD7BB8AA8D1F9C46D435A50AD18931F171965
not vulnerable, no DH EXPORT ciphers,
not vulnerable, no SSL3 or TLS1
SSL Labs's 'SSL Server Rating Guide' (version 2009q from 2020-01-30)
Grade capped to A. HSTS is not offered

info.name: Header Based Generic OOB Interaction
author: pdteam
info.description: The remote server fetched a spoofed URL from the request headers.

interaction.raw-request:
;; opcode: QUERY, status: NOERROR, id: 61119
;; flags:; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 0, AUTHORITY: 0, ADDITIONAL: 1

;; OPT PSEUDOSECTION:
; EDNS: version 0; flags: do; udp: 512
; COOKIE: 786ab15183219443

;; QUESTION SECTION:
;spoofed.canb77ns6j5vv5n3o570gxskixtkj73bw.oast.me.	IN	 AAAA
interaction.raw-response:
;; opcode: QUERY, status: NOERROR, id: 61119
;; flags: qr aa; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 1, AUTHORITY: 2, ADDITIONAL: 2

;; QUESTION SECTION:
;spoofed.canb77ns6j5vv5n3o570gxskixtkj73bw.oast.me.	IN	 AAAA

;; ANSWER SECTION:
spoofed.canb77ns6j5vv5n3o570gxskixtkj73bw.oast.me.	3600	IN	A	178.128.209.14

;; AUTHORITY SECTION:
spoofed.canb77ns6j5vv5n3o570gxskixtkj73bw.oast.me.	3600	IN	NS	ns1.oast.me.
spoofed.canb77ns6j5vv5n3o570gxskixtkj73bw.oast.me.	3600	IN	NS	ns2.oast.me.

;; ADDITIONAL SECTION:
ns1.oast.me.	3600	IN	A	178.128.209.14
ns2.oast.me.	3600	IN	A	178.128.209.14

nuclei.curl-command: curl -X 'GET' -d '' -H 'Accept: */*' -H 'Accept-Language: en' -H 'Cache-Control: no-transform' -H 'Cf-Connecting_ip: spoofed.canb77ns6j5vv5n3o570o9bj6n1fnds4a.oast.me' -H 'Client-Ip: spoofed.canb77ns6j5vv5n3o570zs6rboig818dj.oast.me' -H 'Contact: root@canb77ns6j5vv5n3o570w6w8cqkfhxb1o.oast.me' -H 'Forwarded: for=spoofed.canb77ns6j5vv5n3o5707fbjdthaw9awn.oast.me;by=spoofed.canb77ns6j5vv5n3o570x54tuca6wa8yw.oast.me;host=spoofed.canb77ns6j5vv5n3o570f77pn1m4oc54w.oast.me' -H 'From: root@canb77ns6j5vv5n3o570z8efz8qxda4uc.oast.me' -H 'Referer: http://canb77ns6j5vv5n3o570a55gnq5pts33u.oast.me/ref' -H 'True-Client-Ip: spoofed.canb77ns6j5vv5n3o57018d7r4oj8nwod.oast.me' -H 'User-Agent: Nuclei - Open-source project (github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei)' -H 'X-Client-Ip: spoofed.canb77ns6j5vv5n3o570uwb1bhah76far.oast.me' -H 'X-Forwarded-For: spoofed.canb77ns6j5vv5n3o570gxskixtkj73bw.oast.me' -H 'X-Forwarded-Host: spoofed.canb77ns6j5vv5n3o570tssz3h88kc1kj.oast.me' -H 'X-Forwarded-Server: spoofed.canb77ns6j5vv5n3o570ynt6w7oyxmeg7.oast.me' -H 'X-HTTP-Host-Override: spoofed.canb77ns6j5vv5n3o570yxdeg81gu44xi.oast.me' -H 'X-Host: spoofed.canb77ns6j5vv5n3o5707a9kgxta4436x.oast.me' -H 'X-Originating-Ip: spoofed.canb77ns6j5vv5n3o570bhcwwe7pi5m8b.oast.me' -H 'X-Real-Ip: spoofed.canb77ns6j5vv5n3o570mq7te8wer5kwg.oast.me' -H 'X-Wap-Profile: http://canb77ns6j5vv5n3o57018pjghjak8xam.oast.me/wap.xml' 'https://www.ars.sante.fr'

accessibility.title: Accessibility
accessibility.description: These checks highlight opportunities to [improve the accessibility of your web app](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility). Only a subset of accessibility issues can be automatically detected so manual testing is also encouraged.
accessibility.manualDescription: These items address areas which an automated testing tool cannot cover. Learn more in our guide on [conducting an accessibility review](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility/how-to-review).

seo.title: SEO
seo.description: These checks ensure that your page is optimized for search engine results ranking. There are additional factors Lighthouse does not check that may affect your search ranking. [Learn more](https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/35769).
seo.manualDescription: Run these additional validators on your site to check additional SEO best practices.

pwa.title: Progressive Web App
pwa.description: These checks validate the aspects of a Progressive Web App. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/progressive-web-apps/checklist).
pwa.manualDescription: These checks are required by the baseline [PWA Checklist](https://developers.google.com/web/progressive-web-apps/checklist) but are not automatically checked by Lighthouse. They do not affect your score but it's important that you verify them manually.
